29.text:
Welcome to Fieldsports Britain. Coming up
I am at this trade fair here. The tackle and

35.text:
gun show looking at fishing tackle. Sporting
rifle expert Tim Pilbeam is looking at 3 Christmas

42.text:
packages, rifles for under £900. First Andy
Crow has been shot at by poachers. We investigate.

52.text:
Like thousands of law-abiding shooters all
over the country, Andy Crow enjoys an evening

60.text:
In 99% of cases the evening will pass without
incident, but now and again you can come across

68.text:
Me and a friend were out shooting. We were
out lamping and as we were going round, he

74.text:
has got a few pheasants, well it is just a
small little family pheasant shoot really,

79.text:
and I was just helping out shooting the foxes.
And it was about quarter to ten or ten to

85.text:
ten, something like that. We were just trundling
down, went down across one field and we were

91.text:
coming back up. I said to him there is a vehicle
just stopped over on the road there and didn't

97.text:
know who it was. I said there is a torch shining
up into the trees.

101.text:
Andy and his friend went to have a closer
look and realised that someone was lamping

106.text:
the roosting pheasants, shooting them off
the branches with a .22 rifle. Andy shone

113.text:
his lamp on the truck hoping they'd move on
- they didn't, and things got nasty...

119.text:
3 of us were outside and my boy was in the
back of the van and we were standing there

123.text:
and he just walked up the bank and he just
up with his rifle, cracked one round off and

128.text:
then cracked another round off and by the
second round we were on our way. Then he went

133.text:
down and leant on a gate and let another round
off across after us. Definitely 100% shooting

142.text:
Andy drove the truck away and took cover at
the far end of the field, as their exit was

147.text:
blocked. He switched off the lights and his
friend called the police.

152.text:
We rang the police, rang 999 they put us straight
through we were talking to this chap on the

159.text:
phone and they had another shot at us, they
leant on the gate and took another shot at

162.text:
us. This isn't a .22 air rifle this is a .22
live.

168.text:
Because they had no idea where the poachers
had gone, they stuck tight but had to wait

172.text:
an hour and 10 minutes before two unarmed
police officers arrived.

179.text:
All it was was unarmed police. We were gobsmacked.
I said to the chap, well he is armed, where's

186.text:
the armed response and he said oh they are
coming from Guildford.

192.text:
Andy still isn't sure if armed response turned
up. No one has called him. But even if they

198.text:
did, it was too late and Andy feels that when
there was such a clear threat to life there

205.text:
When we bloodly needed it they weren't there.
Well I don't know, it has wound me up. I am

214.text:
not going to go into it because I know the
old bill has a lot to do. They have got a

217.text:
lot of work on their plates, but it frightened
me as much as anything. To think these people

225.text:
go to such extremes for just over a £1 pheasant.
That was too close for comfort when you have

230.text:
got when you have .22 rounds whistling past
your ear hole.

234.text:
A number of issues are raised by this incident
- Why did it take the police so long to arrive

239.text:
at the scene, and then with unarmed officers?
Would things have been different if Andy had

244.text:
been in a town? and on a more positive note
what should shooters do if they come come

252.text:
Well this is what Surrey Police says in a
statement...

255.text:
"A man had called 999 after noticing some
other men in the fields acting suspiciously.

261.text:
The man asked the men to leave when he claims
one of them fired a single shot from a firearm

266.text: into the ground before leaving the scene.

269.text:
The information relayed by Kent Police and
the appropriate protocol for dealing with

276.text:
We were also told by Surrey Police that Andy's
friend was visited by officers the next day

283.text:
and he'd told them that he was happy with
the way the incident had been managed...However,

289.text:
he can't have been that happy, because he
told US he's made a formal complaint against

297.text: As for Andy he has some advice.

301.text:
Any keepers out there, I tell you don't approach
these old boys. Doesn't matter how hard you

305.text: are, you are not as hard as a bullet.

307.text:
Well from Andy on the farm to David on the
Fieldsports Channel News Stump.

321.text:
Shooting organisations have condemned the
decision by high-street newsagent WHSmith

324.text:
to ban under 14-year-olds from buying shooting
magazines.

328.text:
The company says it has taken this decision
in the erroneous belief that 14 is the legal

333.text:
age for obtaining a firearm. In the UK, there
are many age limits in firearms legislation

338.text:
and 14 is not one of them. BASC has asked
WHSmith to withdraw the policy and is awaiting

345.text:
An American stalker has shot a new world record
moose.

350.text:
Bob Condon could fit inside his moose‘s
antlers. The animal weighed more than 1500lb

354.text:
and had an antler spread of 73 inches. Bob
shot it at 400 yards with a Browning A-bolt

362.text:
with a 260-grain bullet in .375 Holland & Holland
calibre.

366.text:
Want to help the fight for repeal against
the ban on hunting with hounds?

372.text:
The Countryside Alliance and the Council of
Hunting Associations have launched a Hunting

376.text:
Action Pack "containing all the tools you
need in order to explain, promote and defend

383.text:
There is a new British rod-caught record blue
shark - but it is not an official record.

390.text:
This 248lb giant is the largest to be caught
in British waters. It was reeled in by 43-year-old

397.text:
Bob Pollard, 11 miles off Penzance, in Cornwall,
and beats the previous best by 26lb. It does

403.text:
not qualify as an official record because
they have to measured on land.

410.text: Rhino poaching is on the up in South Africa.

413.text:
South Africa has lost 430 rhinos to poaching
since January this year, according to the

419.text:
South African government. Around 21,000 rhinos,
both black and white, remain in South Africa,

425.text: about 70% of the world's rhino population.

430.text:
And finally, a squirrel has made a dramatic
exit from a fourth-storey flat in Germany.

436.text:
It's the wildlife story of the week. The squirrel
runs round and round the kitchen in a panic,

440.text:
then makes a terrifying leap for freedom.
It takes a second or two for the cameraman

444.text:
to catch up with it. And there it is - it
survived.

449.text:
You are now up to date with Fieldsports Britain
News. Stalking the stories. Fishing for facts.

461.text:
Now thinking of a rifle for Christmas? Well,
Tim Pilbeam has a few packages for your loved

470.text:
Here we have three bundles of rifle joy - three
UK distributors have put together some super

476.text:
price-busting kit in time for Christmas - The
cheapest is under 600 quid, the most expensive

483.text:
under 900 and Sporting Rifle magazine's rifle
reviewer Tim Pilbeam is going to talk us through

489.text:
This is the new Ruger American recently launched
into the UK. This is in .243 calibre, entry

496.text:
level rifle, got very, very compact magazine,
which holds 5 rounds. The trigger itself is

504.text:
a 4lb trigger. It is quite a tough trigger
actually. We will find out when we do the

509.text:
shooting how good it is. As to all these rifles
being entry level, stocks are quite hollow

516.text:
and also the fore end , they are quite bendy.
That is what you pay for with a more expensive

520.text:
rifle. If you are having a heavy bolt moderator
and bipod you will have a few problems there,

527.text:
because it may affect the point of impact.
The rifle itself is £599 and today I have

534.text:
actually put a ...... 3x12x50 scope with some
millet mounts and we will see how it shoots

542.text:
This is the Savage package from Edgar Brothers.
This package is actually £649. So you can

550.text:
go fox shooting or deer stalking for £649.
So what do we get. We got a savage access

557.text:
rifle here. This one is in treble 250. Once
again a budget stock, with a bendy fore end,

565.text:
ok we have talked about that. A firm trigger
and it shoots very well, very predictable

570.text:
when you fire it. It has got a reasonably
smooth bolt, so there is nothing wrong with

575.text:
that at all and in the package you get a picatinny
style rail, some mounts and also a 3x12 weaver

583.text:
scope, which has got a really very fine reticule
and it shoots really, really well. It is a

590.text:
nice looking rifle. Accuracy about an inch
at 100 yards and I quite like it. It is good.

598.text:
Last but not least we have got the stealth
hunter combo for £899 from Highland Outdoors.

606.text:
This is superb value for money. What do we
get. We have got a Howa model 1500 action

613.text:
blue sporter barrel. We have got a Hogue over
moulded stock. We have got a fibre glass chassy

620.text:
over moulded with rubber material, very grippable.
I actually love this, you either love it or

626.text:
hate it. It think it is brilliant. The trigger
is a 2 ½ lb trigger which I find absolutely

631.text:
superb. The bolt itself as always with a Howa
is smooth works beautifully well and in the

638.text:
kit there is a Picatinny style rail which
is screwed to the receiver, mounts and 2 ½

644.text:
-12 x 50 seats Nikko Stirling diamond scope
with a illuminator reticule. All this for

651.text:
£899. If you want a Varmint barrel or Sainstill
barrel the price will go up to £1069 including

659.text:
VAT ready to go. Absolutely superb, but does
it shoot well.

665.text:
We have got 3 targets here. We have got a
fox at 200 yards, a side ways fox, we have

671.text:
got a moving fox at 150 yards and we have
also got another fox down the bottom there

677.text:
which is 50 yards away. And we are going to
have a bit of fun today. It is a competition

681.text:
between Matt and I. We are going to shoot
these foxes. We are going to call the given

685.text:
targets, A , B and C and when you are out
foxing at night time the fox does actually

691.text:
stop and start and sometimes it completely
disappears and if you are lamping then suddenly

699.text:
you find there is a fox 50 yards away or another
one appears 200 yards away. So this is very

703.text:
much what happens at night time. So it is
all about quick thinking, good lamping if

708.text:
you have got a lamp and it is actually decision
making and to make it more interesting we

713.text:
have 3 seconds to take the shot. So one person
will be calling A, B or C and you have got

718.text: 3 seconds to reset your rifle and shoot it.

722.text:
Before we start lets have a look at version
five of the running target on Tim's range..

726.text: This time it looks like he's cracked it...

728.text:
Got it running on a bit of rope now. I have
stabilised the steering so it doesn't move

732.text:
at all. So all it does is goes backwards and
forwards so we have a chance of actually shooting

738.text:
Tim's shooting mate Matt starts things off
with the Howa on the bipod... and we get some

743.text: pleasing results on all the targets.

746.text:
Ok Matt, B...A...B..C..B....B has gone go
to A

753.text:
So Matt what do you think of the Stealth Hunter
Combo?

789.text:
Fantastic piece of kit, 5 shots, 5 hits. Doesn't
get any better than that for under £1000.

796.text:
Next up it's Tim with the Savage. As there's
no bipod as part of the bundle Tim is using

801.text:
the tree trunk for support. ..and again the
rifle and the man behind it make this challenging

808.text:
Finally it's the Ruger. Again all the bullets
find their targets.

817.text:
So what do these two experienced shots think
of the hardware on test today?

823.text:
So Matt we have got 3 rifles under £900 and
we were doing some fairly extreme conditions

827.text:
today, all rifle shooting under an inch and
a half. What do you think?

830.text:
I think they are 3 fantastic packages for
someone starting out in the shooting world.

836.text:
I particularly liked the safety catch on the
Ruger. It is a great brand as well.

842.text:
That is £599. I wasn't too keen on the trigger,
but I am sure someone could play on the trigger

847.text: on that. But it performed very, very well.

850.text:
The Savage is just great, great value for
money and the scope on that I particularly

858.text:
£649 and it shoots beautifully well, so there
is nothing wrong with that at all.

863.text:
My favourite of the 3 was the Howa package
I found I shot that really well and it felt

876.text:
I think overall we have got 3 rifles all under
a £1000. You can just walk out the door and

881.text:
shoot and I think that is absolutely fantastic
to see. Well done guys this is brilliant.

885.text:
Unfortunately the firebird targets didn't
get a chance to shine so Matt has an excuse

890.text:
to bring out his £6000 custom rifle just
for fun. It may be 10 times as much as the

897.text:
Ruger but it just shows that there's something
out there for everyone and every pocket.

902.text:
For more information about the Ruger visit
the Viking Arms website, for details on the

906.text:
Howa visit the Highland Outdoors and for the
Savage you need to take a look at Edgar Brothers's

911.text: website. Happy shopping - I mean shooting.

915.text:
Next it is back to David for the map that
matters. It is Calendar.

921.text:
Now for some dates for the diary and some
seasonal reminders.

928.text:
Moon is waxing crescent, following the new
moon on Monday 15th October. We're still ten

933.text:
days away from a full moon, so a good time
to go lamping and protect those pheasant poults.

938.text:
Talking of which, the pheasant shooting season
is getting going. The culmination of the year's

943.text:
work by gamekeepers will reach its peak around
Christmas. There are plenty of days still

947.text:
available on good quality shoots. If you have
a shoot and would like to publicise it on

952.text: Fieldsports Channel, talk to James james@fieldsportschannel.tv

958.text:
The foxhunting season proper is just around
the corner. This week is National Newcomers'

963.text:
Week which runs from 16th-23rd October and,
as its name suggests, will see hunts across

969.text:
the country welcome those who have never tried
it to a day's hunting. This is hunting ‘within

974.text:
the law'. If you would like to give the sport
a go, contact the Countryside Alliance www.countryside-alliance.org.uk

981.text:
Now you need to put 25th October in your diaries
because you could get 20% off clothing, footwear

987.text:
and accessories at Independent Shooting Supplies
in Mountnessing in Essex. It starts at 5pm

993.text:
and goes through to 9 and the first 10 people
through the door will get 20% off some items,

998.text:
the next 10 people get 10% off, and there
is a charity raffle - all proceeds going to

1003.text:
Essex Air Ambulance - where the star prize
is a day's pigeonshooting with Fieldsports

1008.text:
Channel star Andy Crow. So that is Independent
Shooting Supplies, Mountnessing, Essex on

1013.text:
25th October. For more information call Andrew
Stephens on 01277 356181 or email admin@independent-tool.co.uk.

1023.text: That is our round up for this week.

1031.text:
From what is on in the future to what was
on last weekend the Tackle and Gun Trade Show.

1037.text: I have been looking at fishing kit.

1041.text:
Looking for innovation at the Tackle & Gun
show? Well, forget the gun part - this year

1046.text:
it was all about tackle. And you have to ask
just how bad the recession and the outlook

1051.text:
for British industry really is when there
are stories to tell like this one from Northumberland.

1056.text: Pretty new aren't you, when did you get going?

1060.text:
We are new to market we have been researching
the technology now for 4 years and behind

1064.text:
the lines, myself and the other founders,
Alan and Ian who have been with me right from

1068.text:
the beginning. We have been working in a small
industrial unit in Alnwick, keeping ourselves

1072.text:
away from the world, getting the product right,
getting everything ready for market. We then

1076.text:
went through an investment round last November
and we raised money to go to market, set up

1080.text:
a factory and employ people. As I alluded
earlier on, we were having a quick chat before

1084.text:
you started filming, we have got 72 people
in Alnwick at the moment that we employ who

1089.text:
are making these ....for us and we are starting
to ship them globally now.

1093.text: For more about Lynx, have a look at www.lynx-fishing.com.

1099.text:
Even the foreigners at the show are feeling
good about the trade. Here's a German from

1102.text:
an American company that sells all kinds of
fishing tackle brands including Browning fishing

1108.text:
rods - apparently the biggest selling poles
in the UK. He has a new Quantum reel to show

1114.text:
These reels are the first in the industry
which have an actual skeletal design we left

1119.text:
out all the metal where it doesn't matter
for the construction so these reels are extremely

1124.text:
strong and on our website you can even see
the pick-up truck runs over it without damaging

1129.text:
the reel, you can still turn it. So it is
really strong but light at the same time.

1134.text:
The fishermen now a days have space age material
in their fishing rods which weigh nothing

1138.text:
so they don't want to have a clumsy reel on
it. So light bait cast is perfect, but it

1143.text:
withstands the impact of fishing and they
can enjoy it for a long time. And the design

1147.text:
of course needs to underline the technology
a bit. So you have a lot of metal there - modern

1151.text:
At the risk of sounding like something out
of a Quentin Tarantino film, you can see Frerk's

1163.text:
That's the carp and sea angling crew. Now
gamefishing has gone punk. The salmon fly

1168.text:
was a thing of beauty and tradition - until
the flytiers at Fulling Mill redesigned it

1172.text:
during what must have been a wild weekend
in Ibiza.

1175.text: Have you caught fish with these flies.

1177.text:
Absolutely we have tested many of these flies.
In fact most of them over the last 18 months

1182.text:
or so, abroad and in the UK. They fish very,
very well. There is something for spring,

1189.text:
summer, autumn. So we cover all the seasons.
We cover all the depths anglers can fish on

1197.text:
and we have flies that cover south America.
We have got a pattern for basically everywhere.

1203.text: They are all on display at www.fullingmill.com

1208.text:
Tackle and Gun is not all about fishing. For
one member of the tackle trade it is about

1214.text:
News reaches me that recently off Milford
Haven, South Wales, you saw a shark, what

1221.text:
A big shark. I am not sure what type of shark,
but it was a big shark.

1223.text: I want to say a Great White Shark.

1225.text:
You can say what it was, you can tell me what
it was. It was a huge, huge fish. We were

1232.text:
blue shark fishing, catching fish up to 100lbs
all day, seeing dolphins that were around

1237.text:
500, 600lbs out of the ......all of a sudden,
out of nowhere at the side of the boat that

1244.text:
I and my fishing partner were fishing from
this huge fish came up through the depths,

1252.text:
didn't actually look us in the eye but came
up to our shoulders, it tilted. Honestly it

1258.text:
was 3 times the size of the dolphins we had
seen that day. It must have been upwards of

1265.text:
There's lots of unbelievable kit at the Tackle
& Gun show. And if you don't believe Paul,

1269.text:
get in touch with him to complain at his website
www.wychwood.co.uk

1275.text:
From the small world of a British trade show
to the wide world. It is Hunting YouTube.

1281.text:
This is Hunting YouTube, which aims to show
the best hunting, shooting and fishing videos

1288.text:
MrSmith434 is 17 years old and from Ireland.
Here he is pigeon shooting over barley in

1293.text:
County Meath. He finishes two days with 110
crows, 31 pigeons and nine grey crows.

1301.text:
CountryPursuitsTV was at the Tackle & Gun
trade show 2012. He had a look at some of

1306.text:
the shooting kit on offer, including NiteSite,
Brocockand the new Pulsar N750 digisight

1312.text:
I prefer stars with better figures but in
the world of shooting TV, you pays your money

1317.text:
and you takes your choc ice. Ferreting by
combatmn2005 has extra drama because part

1323.text:
of the action takes place on a railway line.
I hope it's not giving away too much to let

1328.text:
you know that neither of them nor the dog
gets run over by a train.

1332.text:
Our favourite freelance cameraman Nicky Brown
is fly fishing on the River Avon. His Wilderness

1336.text:
TV channel, which appears on YouTube under
the name TechSecMedia, sees Nick Lawrence

1341.text:
giving advice and tips on how to fish a famous
chalkstream.

1345.text:
At the other end of the fishy scale, Yuri
Grisendi is pleased to have caught two catfish

1350.text:
of more than 200lb in Kazakhstan's Ili Delta.
The Italians dominate world interest in catfish

1356.text:
on YouTube, so here is Yuri's translation:
luca foroni combatte con un enorme siluro

1362.text:
catturato a clonk sul delta del fiume ili
in Kazachistan. There you go. Ole.

1367.text:
Let's go abroad for some silly videos. This
may be the silliest. Shooting from water by

1372.text:
CristiClujeanul shows a Romanian AK47 made
by Cugir (Romak) in .223 Remington, with aftermarket

1378.text:
folding stock by Mako, Tapco muzzle brake,
handguard and pistol grip in a typical AK47

1384.text: shooting situation…if you are Arnold Schwarzenegger..

1388.text:
Meanwhile, the German channel JagdStifti wins
the prize for Most Pointless Hunting Videos.

1394.text:
Like almost all of his films, this one shows
minute after long minute of nothing happening

1398.text:
at all - which is a true reflection of going
shooting but it doesn't make gripping TV.

1402.text:
In this film called Gänsejagd , Goose Hunting,
he reaches new heights by being in the right

1408.text:
place at the right time but pointing the camera
in the wrong direction.

1411.text:
Now for pure romance. New Forest Red Stag
Hunt (short version) by ShavesgreenShooting

1416.text:
is a trophy red stag stalking outing with
Shavesgreen Safaris in England's New Forest.

1423.text:
You can click on any of these films to watch
them. If you have a YouTube film you would

1426.text:
like us to pop in to the weekly top eight,
send it in via YouTube, or email me the link

1434.text:
Well if you like shooting you will love the
Shooting Show.

1438.text:
It's Argyllshire deerstalking. Pete, Byron
and the team from Sporting Rifle magazine

1443.text:
take to the hills in search of red stags.
Assistant publisher Ruth is first behind the

1449.text:
rifle, with estate stalker Mark taking her
in search of a takeable beast. As always,

1454.text:
the deer don't make themselves easy to stalk
into, and the rapidly closing weather adds

1458.text:
a further challenge. Ruth, taking only her
second ever stag, then gives us her thoughts

1464.text:
on the rifle, the stalk and the end result.
It's all in this week's Shooting Show. If

1469.text:
you are watching this on YouTube, click on
the link.

1473.text:
We are back next week. If you are watching
this on Youtube don't hesitate to hit the

1478.text:
subscribe button which is somewhere up in
the sky above me or go to our show page www.youtube.com/show/fieldsportsbritain

1487.text:
or our website www.fieldsportschannel.tv where
you can click to like us on Facebook follow

1493.text:
us on Twitter or scroll down to the bottom,
right hand side of the page and pop your email

1497.text:
address into our constant contact box and
we will constantly email you about our weekly

1502.text:
programme which is out 7pm Wednesdays. This
has been Fieldsports Britain.
